data.title: Tom Tywker’s ‘Three’ Leads Lolas With Six German Film Award nominations
data.meta_description: But while "Three" leads this year’s Lola race it is a close field.
data.text:
COLOGNE, Germany — Tom Tykwer’s menage-a-trois dramedy Three got love from all sides when it picked up six nominations for Germany’s top film honors, the Lolas.

Three grabbed noms in the best film and best director categories, as well as a best actress nom for Sophie Rois as a 40-something TV presenter caught between her long-time boyfriend and a new lover. The film was also nominated for best picture and sound editing and for best score.

But while Three leads this year’s Lola race it is a close field.

Three films received five Lola noms — Chris Kraus’ period drama The Poll Diaries, Ralf Huettner’s Vincent Wants to Sea— a road movie involving a man with Tourette’s syndrome, an anorexic and an obsessive compulsive — and If Not Us, Who? Andres Veiel’s look at the origins of two of Germany’s most notorious terrorists.

Three more lightweight films snuck into the best film category – Yasemin Samdereli’s integration comedy Almanya, the soccer film Der Ganz Grosse Traumfrom director Sebastian Groblerand Young Goethe in Love, Philipp Stolzl’s rom com look at the legendary 18th century German poet.

Wim Wenders’ 3-D dance film Pina, which premiered to rave reviews at the Berlin Film Festival last month, picked up Lola noms for best director and best documentary.

The winners of the 2011 Lola Awards will be announced April 8 in Berlin.

The Nominees for the 2011 German Film Awards (Lolas)

Best Film

Almanya, Dir. Yasemin Samdereli

Three, Dir. Tom Tykwer

Der Ganz Grosse Traum, Dir. Sebastian Grobler

Goethe!, Dir. Philipp Stolzl

Vincent Wants to Sea, Dir. Ralf Huettner

If Not Us, Who?, Dir. Andres Veiel

Best Director

Florian Cossen for The Day I Was Not Born

TomTykwer for Three

Wim Wenders for Pina

Best Actress

Bernadette Heerwagen for The Days to Come

Lena Lauzemis for If Not Us, Who?

Sophie Rois for Three

Best Actor

August Diehl for If Not Us, Who?

Alexander Fehling for Young Goethein Love

Florian David Fitz for Vincent Wants to Sea

Best Documentary

Kinshasa Symphony, Dir. Claus Wischmann, Martin Baer

Pina, Dir. Wim Wenders

Best Children’s Film

Chandani And Her Elephant, Dir. Arne Birkenstock

Animals United, Dir. Holger Tappe, Reinhard Klooss

Best Screenplay

Miraz Bezar for Min Dit

Florian David Fitz for Vincent Wants to Sea

Nesrim Samdereli and Yasemin Samdereli for Almanya

Best Supporting Actress

Meret Becker for Boxhagener Platz

Katharina Muller-Elmau for Vincent Wants to Sea

Beatriz Spelzini for The Day I Was Not Born

Best Supporting Actor

Vedat Erincin for Shahada

Heino Ferch for Vincent Wants to Sea

Richy Muller for The Poll Diaries

Best Cinematography

Matthias Fleischer for The Day I Was Not Born

Daniela Knapp for The Poll Diaries

Martin Langer for Der Ganz Grosse Traum

Best Editing

Mathilde Bonnefoy for Three

Ueli Christen for We Are The Night

Hansjorg Weissbrich for If Not Us, Who?

Best Set Design

Silke Buhr for The Poll Diaries

Christian M. Goldbeck for If Not Us, Who?

Udo Kramer for Young Goethe in Love

Best Costume Design

Monika Jacobs for Der Ganz Grosse Traum

Thomas Olah for Jew Suss – Rise and Fall

Gioia Raspe for The Poll Diaries

Best Make Up

Kitty Kratschke and Heike Merker for Young Goethe in Love

Bjorn Rehbein for Jew Suss – Rise and Fall

Susana Sanchez for The Poll Diaries

Best Score

Matthias Klein for The Day I Was Not Born

Heiko Maile for We Are The Night

Tom Tykwer, Johnny Klimek, Reinhold Heil,

and Gabriel Isaac Mounsey for Three
